intro: Adisca subfalcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It produces cylindrical, woody pods that contain several seeds. Adisca subfalcata is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
